title: Use Animals to Find Water
brief: Follow animal behavior patterns to locate water sources in tropical environments.
steps: Step 1: Look for grazing animals like deer - they drink at dawn and dusk and stay near water.
Step 2: Follow converging game trails which often lead to water sources.
Step 3: Watch grain-eating birds (finches, pigeons) - they fly straight and low toward water at dawn/dusk.
Step 4: Observe bees - they range within 6 kilometers of water sources.
Step 5: Follow ant columns marching up trees to find small water reservoirs.
Step 6: Look for flies, especially European mason flies with iridescent green bodies - they stay within 100 meters of water.
Step 7: Follow human tracks which usually lead to wells or water sources.
warnings: Do not rely on carnivores - they get moisture from prey and can go long periods without water.
Water birds fly long distances - not reliable indicators.
Birds of prey get liquids from victims - cannot be used as water indicators.
